results.title: What is a map?
results.brief_description: A small girl, writing to her friend, attempts to explain what her bedroom looks like. By use of animation and photographic techniques, the concept of maps is introduced and explained, first in terms of the living room plan and then in terms of a map of the neighbourhood.
results.description: A small girl, writing to her friend, attempts to explain what her bedroom looks like. By use of animation and photographic techniques, the concept of maps is introduced and explained, first in terms of the living room plan and then in terms of a map of the neighbourhood.

results.title: What is a limit? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Nelson, Edward Goldwyn and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Analysis is that branch of mathematics which gives precision to vague terms like ‘infinitely large’ and ‘infinitesimally small’ and is founded on the concept of a limit. In this program, ideas behind a limit are examined and a formal definition to the limit of a sequence is reached.
results.description: Analysis is that branch of mathematics which gives precision to vague terms like ‘infinitely large’ and ‘infinitesimally small’ and is founded on the concept of a limit. results.title: What is a firefighter?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces Brion Jones, Station Officer, M.F.B. who outlines the training and different tasks performed by fireman including rescuing people from fires, extinguishing fires, preventing the spread and property damage caused by fires, road rescue, assisting with chemical incidents, gas leaks and unusual rescues from cliffs, trenches and drains.

results.title: What is a curriculum day?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: A primary and postprimary teacher and parent/school councillor outline what is involved in a curriculum day. They discuss the benefits for both parents and teachers in evaluating school programs and ideas to facilitate the development of working relationships between both parties.

results.title: What is a computer? (NP)
results.creator_credit: Robert Reid, International Computers and Video Arts
results.brief_description: This film gives an introduction to the computer. Explains the relationship between the central processing unit and the computer’s peripherals - the video console, the printer, the card reader, the magnetic tape unit and the disc unit. Narrated by John Cleese. Also suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: What is a computer?
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hayward, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Uses animation to dispel some of the mysteries about computers, while systematically presenting the basic ideas about computer operations. Explains storage of information, processing of input data, and printing out of responses. Demonstrates use of a flow chart and the diagram logic circuits of the AND, NOT and OR relations. An excellent and interesting explanation for beginners. Writen by Stan Hayward.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Hayward, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: What if your town....?
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film shows how to set up a “mutual aid” plan, which is a system of self-help whereby members of an industrial estate can pool their disaster and fire fighting resources for their mutual benefit.
results.description: This film shows how to set up a “mutual aid” plan, which is a system of self-help whereby members of an industrial estate can pool their disaster and fire fighting resources for their mutual benefit.

results.title: What happens when you're sick?
results.creator_credit: Michael Heldman and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Shows why we experience symptoms such as fever, sneezing, upset stomach and diarrhoea when we’re sick and symptoms such as bleeding, swelling, and pain when we’re injured.
results.description: Shows why we experience symptoms such as fever, sneezing, upset stomach and diarrhoea when we’re sick and symptoms such as bleeding, swelling, and pain when we’re injured.

results.title: What happens inside?
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to record growth of a fertilised mammal egg. The terms gestation, umbilicus and placenta are explained. Shows birth of a litter of kittens and compares mother’s care of kittens to that of humans. Describes the first four months of human foetal development. From the series “Family living and sex eduation”.

This discussion has particular reference to the problem of housing for the aged.
